name: rngo0lid
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4
body: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(co(c3, c4, c1), c1))

stmt.origin: sylan(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(co(c3, c4, c1), c1), wcel(c4, cgr))
stmt.pretty: sylan(c0 ∈ RingOps, c1 ∈ c2, (c3[c4]c1)= c1, c4 ∈ GrpOp)

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(co(c3, c4, c1), c1))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c4, cgr))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c4, cgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(co(c3, c4, c1), c1))
body.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ RingOps ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→(c3[c4]c1)= c1)
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c4 ∈ GrpOp)
⊣ ((c4 ∈ GrpOp ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→(c3[c4]c1)= c1)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c4, cgr))

cumulated.origin:

⊢ ((c0 ∈ RingOps ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→(c3[c4]c1)= c1)

⊣ c3 =(GId ` c4)

comment: The additive identity of a ring is a left identity element. (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 9-Sep-2007.) (New usage is discouraged.)
